subject: RE: [junit] testing WebStart apps
msgSnippet: ... http://userid:passwd@url.com =jason Thanks for the response Jason, but WebStart is just the mechanism for launching Java apps, we use it here to launch our
messageBody:
> >
> > I'm trying to think of a good way to test some Java apps. that are
> > launched by WebStart. I've setup some basic tests with
> HTTPUnit that
> > go to the launch page, follow each WebStart link and ensure that a
> > valid JNLP file is retrieved for each simulated link click.
> What I'd
> > really like to do is to actually load each app, get past the login
> > screen and verify each app's main frame is bought up without any
> > database exceptions etc.
> >
> > Can anyone advise on how best to accomplish this?
>
> I am not familiar with WebStart, but could you pass the
> username and password along on the web address? Eg.
http://userid:passwd@...

=jason

Thanks for the response Jason,
but WebStart is just the mechanism for launching Java apps, we use it
here
to launch our suite of Swing based client apps. I would like to test
successful downloading and launching of the apps from the server
via WebStart, I guess I am looking for WebStartUnit...

Thanks,
Sean
